trans-unit.source: Analyze Twitter data with Apache Hive on HDInsight | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Analyze Twitter data with Apache Hive on HDInsight | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Python to store Tweets that contain specific keywords, then use Hive and Hadoop on HDInsight to transform the raw TWitter data into a searchable Hive table.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Python to store Tweets that contain specific keywords, then use Hive and Hadoop on HDInsight to transform the raw TWitter data into a searchable Hive table.

trans-unit.source: Analyze Twitter data using Hive in HDInsight
trans-unit.target: Analyze Twitter data using Hive in HDInsight

trans-unit.source: In this document, you will get tweets by using a Twitter streaming API and then use Apache Hive on a Linux-based HDInsight cluster to process the JSON formatted data.
trans-unit.target: In this document, you will get tweets by using a Twitter streaming API and then use Apache Hive on a Linux-based HDInsight cluster to process the JSON formatted data.

trans-unit.source: The result will be a list of Twitter users who sent the most tweets that contained a certain word.
trans-unit.target: The result will be a list of Twitter users who sent the most tweets that contained a certain word.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] While individual pieces of this document can be used with Windows-based HDInsight clusters (Python and Hive for example,) many steps are based on using a Linux-based HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] While individual pieces of this document can be used with Windows-based HDInsight clusters (Python and Hive for example,) many steps are based on using a Linux-based HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: For steps specific to a Windows-based cluster, see [Analyze Twitter data using Hive in HDInsight](hdinsight-analyze-twitter-data.md).
trans-unit.target: For steps specific to a Windows-based cluster, see [Analyze Twitter data using Hive in HDInsight](hdinsight-analyze-twitter-data.md).

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Before you begin this tutorial, you must have the following:
trans-unit.target: Before you begin this tutorial, you must have the following:

trans-unit.source: A __Linux-based Azure HDInsight cluster__.
trans-unit.target: A __Linux-based Azure HDInsight cluster__.

trans-unit.source: For information on creating a cluster, see [Get Started with Linux-based HDInsight](hdinsight-hadoop-linux-tutorial-get-started.md) for steps on creating a cluster.
trans-unit.target: For information on creating a cluster, see [Get Started with Linux-based HDInsight](hdinsight-hadoop-linux-tutorial-get-started.md) for steps on creating a cluster.

trans-unit.source: An __SSH client__.
trans-unit.target: An __SSH client__.

trans-unit.source: For more information on using SSH with Linux-based HDInsight, see the following articles:
trans-unit.target: For more information on using SSH with Linux-based HDInsight, see the following articles:

trans-unit.source: [Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Linux, Unix, or OS X](hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-unix.md)
trans-unit.target: [Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Linux, Unix, or OS X](hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-unix.md)

trans-unit.source: [Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Windows](hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-windows.md)
trans-unit.target: [Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Windows](hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-windows.md)

trans-unit.source: __Python__ and [pip](https://pypi.python.org/pypi/pip)
trans-unit.target: __Python__ and [pip](https://pypi.python.org/pypi/pip)

trans-unit.source: The __Azure CLI__.
trans-unit.target: The __Azure CLI__.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Install and configure the Azure CLI](../xplat-cli-install.md)
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Install and configure the Azure CLI](../xplat-cli-install.md)

trans-unit.source: Get a Twitter feed
trans-unit.target: Get a Twitter feed

trans-unit.source: Twitter allows you to retrieve the [data for each tweet](https://dev.twitter.com/docs/platform-objects/tweets) as a JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) document through a REST API.
trans-unit.target: Twitter allows you to retrieve the [data for each tweet](https://dev.twitter.com/docs/platform-objects/tweets) as a JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) document through a REST API.

trans-unit.source: [OAuth](http://oauth.net) is required for authentication to the API.
trans-unit.target: [OAuth](http://oauth.net) is required for authentication to the API.

trans-unit.source: You must also create a _Twitter Application_ that contains the settings used to access the API.
trans-unit.target: You must also create a _Twitter Application_ that contains the settings used to access the API.

trans-unit.source: Create a Twitter application
trans-unit.target: Create a Twitter application

trans-unit.source: From a web browser, sign in to [https://apps.twitter.com/](https://apps.twitter.com/).
trans-unit.target: From a web browser, sign in to [https://apps.twitter.com/](https://apps.twitter.com/).

trans-unit.source: Click the **Sign up now** link if you don't have a Twitter account.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Sign up now** link if you don't have a Twitter account.

trans-unit.source: Click **Create New App**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Create New App**.

trans-unit.source: Enter **Name**, **Description**, **Website**.
trans-unit.target: Enter **Name**, **Description**, **Website**.

trans-unit.source: You can make up a URL for the **Website** field.
trans-unit.target: You can make up a URL for the **Website** field.

trans-unit.source: The following table shows some sample values to use:
trans-unit.target: The following table shows some sample values to use:

trans-unit.source: Field
trans-unit.target: Field

trans-unit.source: Value
trans-unit.target: Value

trans-unit.source: Name
trans-unit.target: Name

trans-unit.source: MyHDInsightApp
trans-unit.target: MyHDInsightApp

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: MyHDInsightApp
trans-unit.target: MyHDInsightApp

trans-unit.source: Website
trans-unit.target: Website

trans-unit.source: http://www.myhdinsightapp.com
trans-unit.target: http://www.myhdinsightapp.com

trans-unit.source: Check **Yes, I agree**, and then click **Create your Twitter application**.
trans-unit.target: Check **Yes, I agree**, and then click **Create your Twitter application**.

trans-unit.source: Click the **Permissions** tab.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Permissions** tab.

trans-unit.source: The default permission is **Read only**.
trans-unit.target: The default permission is **Read only**.

trans-unit.source: This is sufficient for this tutorial.
trans-unit.target: This is sufficient for this tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Click the **Keys and Access Tokens** tab.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Keys and Access Tokens** tab.

trans-unit.source: Click **Create my access token**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Create my access token**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Test OAuth** in the upper-right corner of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click **Test OAuth** in the upper-right corner of the page.

trans-unit.source: Write down **consumer key**, **Consumer secret**, **Access token**, and **Access token secret**.
trans-unit.target: Write down **consumer key**, **Consumer secret**, **Access token**, and **Access token secret**.

trans-unit.source: You will need the values later.
trans-unit.target: You will need the values later.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] When you use the curl command in Windows, use double quotes instead of single quotes for the option values.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] When you use the curl command in Windows, use double quotes instead of single quotes for the option values.

trans-unit.source: Download tweets
trans-unit.target: Download tweets

trans-unit.source: The following Python code will download 10,000 tweets from Twitter and save them to a file named __tweets.txt__.
trans-unit.target: The following Python code will download 10,000 tweets from Twitter and save them to a file named __tweets.txt__.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The following steps are performed on the HDInsight cluster, since Python is already installed.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The following steps are performed on the HDInsight cluster, since Python is already installed.

trans-unit.source: Connect to the HDInsight cluster using SSH:
trans-unit.target: Connect to the HDInsight cluster using SSH:

trans-unit.source: If you used a password to secure your SSH user account, you will be prompted to enter it.
trans-unit.target: If you used a password to secure your SSH user account, you will be prompted to enter it.

trans-unit.source: If you used a public key, you may have to use the `-i` parameter to specify the matching private key.
trans-unit.target: If you used a public key, you may have to use the `-i` parameter to specify the matching private key.

trans-unit.source: For example, `ssh -i ~/.ssh/id_rsa USERNAME@CLUSTERNAME-ssh.azurehdinsight.net`.
trans-unit.target: For example, `ssh -i ~/.ssh/id_rsa USERNAME@CLUSTERNAME-ssh.azurehdinsight.net`.

trans-unit.source: For more information on using SSH with Linux-based HDInsight, see the following articles:
trans-unit.target: For more information on using SSH with Linux-based HDInsight, see the following articles:

trans-unit.source: [Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Linux, Unix, or OS X](hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-unix.md)
trans-unit.target: [Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Linux, Unix, or OS X](hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-unix.md)

trans-unit.source: [Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Windows](hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-windows)
trans-unit.target: [Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Windows](hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-windows)

trans-unit.source: By default, the __pip__ utility is not installed on the HDInsight head node.
trans-unit.target: By default, the __pip__ utility is not installed on the HDInsight head node.

trans-unit.source: Use the following to install, and then update this utility:
trans-unit.target: Use the following to install, and then update this utility:

trans-unit.source: The code to download tweets relies on [Tweepy](http://www.tweepy.org/) and [Progressbar](https://pypi.python.org/pypi/progressbar/2.2).
trans-unit.target: The code to download tweets relies on [Tweepy](http://www.tweepy.org/) and [Progressbar](https://pypi.python.org/pypi/progressbar/2.2).

trans-unit.source: To install these, use the following command:
trans-unit.target: To install these, use the following command:

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The bits about removing python-openssl, installing python-dev, libffi-dev, libssl-dev, pyOpenSSL and requests[security] is to avoid an InsecurePlatform warning when connecting to Twitter via SSL from Python.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The bits about removing python-openssl, installing python-dev, libffi-dev, libssl-dev, pyOpenSSL and requests[security] is to avoid an InsecurePlatform warning when connecting to Twitter via SSL from Python.

trans-unit.source: Tweepy v3.2.0 is used to avoid [an error](https://github.com/tweepy/tweepy/issues/576) that can occur when processing tweets.
trans-unit.target: Tweepy v3.2.0 is used to avoid [an error](https://github.com/tweepy/tweepy/issues/576) that can occur when processing tweets.

trans-unit.source: Use the following command to create a new file named __gettweets.py__:
trans-unit.target: Use the following command to create a new file named __gettweets.py__:

trans-unit.source: Use the following as the contents of the __gettweets.py__ file.
trans-unit.target: Use the following as the contents of the __gettweets.py__ file.

trans-unit.source: Replace the placeholder information for __consumer/_secret__, __consumer/_key__, __access/_token__, and __access/_token/_secret__ with the information from your Twitter application.
trans-unit.target: Replace the placeholder information for __consumer/_secret__, __consumer/_key__, __access/_token__, and __access/_token/_secret__ with the information from your Twitter application.

trans-unit.source: Use __Ctrl + X__, then __Y__ to save the file.
trans-unit.target: Use __Ctrl + X__, then __Y__ to save the file.

trans-unit.source: Use the following command to run the file and download tweets:
trans-unit.target: Use the following command to run the file and download tweets:

trans-unit.source: A progress indicator should appear, and count up to 100% as the tweets are downloaded and saved to file.
trans-unit.target: A progress indicator should appear, and count up to 100% as the tweets are downloaded and saved to file.

trans-unit.target: Run the HiveQL job

trans-unit.target: This will load the Hive shell, run the HiveQL in the __twitter.hql__ file, and finally return a `hive >` prompt.

trans-unit.source: From the `hive >` prompt, use the following to verify that you can select data from the __tweets__ table created by the HiveQL in the __twitter.hql__ file:
trans-unit.target: From the `hive >` prompt, use the following to verify that you can select data from the __tweets__ table created by the HiveQL in the __twitter.hql__ file:

trans-unit.source: This will return a maximum of 10 tweets that contain the word __Azure__ in the message text.
trans-unit.target: This will return a maximum of 10 tweets that contain the word __Azure__ in the message text.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial we have seen how to transform an unstructured JSON dataset into a structured Hive table to query, explore, and analyze data from Twitter by using HDInsight on Azure.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial we have seen how to transform an unstructured JSON dataset into a structured Hive table to query, explore, and analyze data from Twitter by using HDInsight on Azure.
